hypothesis_content.title: Volatility Compression Breakout Failure in Low Liquidity
hypothesis_content.statement: In a NEUTRAL/BEAR regime with depleted liquidity, breakouts from a 3-day Bollinger Band (20-period, 2 std) squeeze will fail to trend 70% of the time, reversing to the midpoint within 6 hours, as follow-through buying/selling is absent.
hypothesis_content.rationale: A liquidity crash leaves few committed players to provide momentum. Breakouts are often driven by low-volume stops or isolated large orders, not sustained institutional flow, leading to quick reversals.
entry_conditions: BTC 3-day Bollinger Band width (20,2) is at a 10-day low (squeeze)
Price closes outside the Bollinger Band
24-hour exchange volume for BTC is below its 20-day moving average
Cumulative volume delta (CVD) for the breakout candle is weak (< 30% of 10-candle avg CVD)

exit_conditions.take_profit: Price returns to the 20-period SMA (Bollinger midpoint)
exit_conditions.stop_loss: Price moves a further 0.5% in the breakout direction beyond the initial breakout candle close

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: The win rate for fade trades on low-volume Bollinger breakouts is not >65% in periods where aggregate market depth is in its lowest historical quartile.
